page.title: 16HEALTH CARE AT COMMONSIDE
page.content: HEALTH-CARE IS BASED AT HAWICK, WITH DOCTORS, DENTISTS AND HOSPITALS IN THE TOWN. PEOPLE WITH MORE SERIOUS DISORDERS GO 30 MILES TO PEEL HOSPITAL NEAR GALASHIELS. A MATERNITY HOSPITAL IN HAWICK SERVES THE AREA BUT SOME CASES WITH COMPLICATIONS, GO TO EDINBURGH WHICH IS 58 MILES AWAY. A WOMENS' CLINIC IS RUN IN HAWICK FOR BIRTH CONTROL AND SMEAR TESTS FOR CANCER. ALL WOMEN OVER 35 GET AN APPOINTMENT HERE EVERY 5 YEARS FOR CERVICAL SMEAR TESTS AND ATTENDANCE IS VOLUNTARY. MOST WOMEN ATTEND THE CLINIC WHICH IS RUN BY WOMEN DOCTORS. CHILDREN ARE VACCINATED FOR TETANUS, WHOOPING-COUGH, MEASLES AND POLIO AT THEIR DOCTOR'S SURGERY. AT SCHOOL, THEY GET T.B. VACCINATIONS AT 13 AND GIRLS GET RUBELLA VACCINE AT 12, AND MEDICALS TO CHECK THEIR DEVELOPMENT. DENTAL TREATMENT IS PROVIDED AT SCHOOL
